alert.note: Alert for Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 11:03PM CDT until May 08 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Texas, including the following county, Knox. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 PM CDT, Although the rain has ended, areas of high water and flooded roadways will continue. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. A total of 5 to 6 inches of rain fell across the area earlier in the evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Benjamin, Rhineland and Truscott. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
